since_last_update: Primary macro impulse shifted to a labor/rates repricing: January jobs data beat expectations with unemployment at 4.3%, pushing front-end yields up and reducing near-term easing expectations (FT; input headline).

Counterpoint in the same release: annual benchmark revisions reportedly marked prior-year payroll growth materially lower, complicating the ‘tight labor’ signal and keeping two-way rates volatility elevated into CPI (FT).

Rates narrative was already fragile from the prior session: weak retail sales fueled a cuts-friendly interpretation and pulled yields down before the jobs print, setting up whipsaw conditions across equities and gold (Bloomberg).

Gold’s driver mix remains split between real-rate/dollar moves and geopolitical risk premium tied to U.S.-Iran enforcement/tanker headlines; this can decouple gold from equities intraday (Reuters; Barron’s).
today_focus: Dominant driver today: front-end rates repricing off the January jobs report (tightness vs expectations), with equity index futures sensitivity highest in duration-heavy Nasdaq (FT; Reuters).

Watch whether the market treats benchmark revisions as ‘growth-scare’ (bullish duration, supportive gold) or treats lower unemployment/participation dynamics as ‘sticky labor’ (bearish duration, headwind to NQ) (FT).

Fed speak cluster risk: Schmid/Bowman/Hammack today can either validate the rates backup (hawkish pushback on cuts) or re-open easing optionality if they emphasize revisions/soft demand (calendar; Reuters context).

Gold focus: does it trade as a real-yield product (sell on higher yields/stronger USD) or as a risk hedge (bid on geopolitical headlines/vol) given Iran-related enforcement chatter (Reuters; Barron’s).
Rates supply check: 10y auction today and 30y tomorrow are potential volatility nodes if indirect bid/tailed outcomes amplify term-premium chatter into CPI (US Treasury auction calendar).

implied_policy_path: Near-term Fed cuts are being repriced lower (less easing) immediately after the stronger jobs print, consistent with front-end rate futures selling (input headline; FT).

However, prior-session weak retail sales had increased perceived probability of earlier easing, so the market is effectively toggling between ‘soft-demand’ and ‘still-tight-labor’ regimes (Bloomberg; Reuters).
rates: Front-end yields are the transmission channel: higher 2y/real yields mechanically tighten financial conditions for NQ and can cap gold if USD is firm; revisions can invert that quickly if interpreted as growth slowdown (FT).
Auction outcomes are a near-term determinant of whether the curve repricing is orderly vs disorderly (tail-driven) (US Treasury auction calendar).
equities: Equity beta is likely being priced more through rates than earnings today: NQ (duration) more sensitive than ES, with ‘good jobs = fewer cuts’ as the immediate mapping (FT; Reuters).
usd_gold: Gold’s baseline support came from softer data/yields prior to jobs, but post-jobs direction hinges on whether USD/yields extend higher; geopolitical premium can offset rate headwinds episodically (Reuters; Barron’s).
volatility_liquidity: Data-cluster convexity elevated into CPI: positioning can produce sharp intraday reversals as rates reprice in both directions (inference consistent with jobs+retail sales whipsaw; FT; Bloomberg).

risk_register.risk: Rates whipsaw into CPI: conflicting signals (stronger headline jobs vs downward benchmark revisions + soft retail sales) create two-way risk in front-end and real yields, amplifying ES/NQ and gold volatility.
CPI ‘upside surprise’ risk underpriced relative to complacent cuts narrative after soft retail sales; could force abrupt de-risking in duration equities and pressure gold via real-yield jump.
CPI ‘downside surprise’ risk: could reignite aggressive easing expectations and steepen risk-on into NQ, but also signal demand weakness that later flips into growth-scare (bad-good paradox).
risk_register.timeframe: Fri Feb 13, 2026 into early next week.

risk_register.risk: Geopolitical tail (Iran/shipping enforcement) adds fat-tail risk to oil and safe-haven flows; can produce cross-asset correlation breaks (gold bid even if yields firm).
Treasury auction tails (10y/30y) provoke term-premium jump and equity duration hit, independent of macro data direction.
risk_register.timeframe: Wed Feb 11 (10y) and Thu Feb 12 (30y), 1pm ET windows.

event_warnings: Wed Feb 11, 2026: FOMC speakers (Schmid, Bowman, Hammack) — potential for verbal pushback on easing pricing after jobs; could extend front-end selloff or reverse it if they stress revisions/soft demand.
Wed Feb 11, 2026: US 10y auction — monitor for tail/weak indirect bid as a risk-off catalyst via term premium.
Thu Feb 12, 2026: Initial jobless claims — can either validate ‘labor cooling’ (bull duration, supports gold) or reinforce ‘labor still firm’ (bear duration).
Thu Feb 12, 2026: US 30y auction — higher convexity impact on duration-sensitive equity multiples into CPI.
Fri Feb 13, 2026: US CPI (headline/core) — dominant macro catalyst; sets the next multi-session rates/equity/gold regime.
